title: Philippine Statistics Authority (PSA)
content: Official government source for poverty statistics and reports in the Philippines.
note: Best for up-to-date poverty data and demographics.

title: World Bank Philippines
content: Provides analysis and reports on poverty, inequality, and economic development in the Philippines.
note: International perspective with insights on long-term poverty reduction.

title: UNICEF Philippines
content: Focuses on child rights, poverty reduction, education, and social justice programs.
note: Great resource for poverty’s impact on children.

title: Oxfam Pilipinas
content: Works to fight inequality, empower communities, and respond to disasters.
note: NGO perspective on social justice and inequality.

title: Gawad Kalinga
content: Community-based movement addressing poverty through housing and livelihood.

title: Caritas Manila
content: Catholic organization that supports education, livelihood, and relief programs.
note: Faith-based initiative with focus on education and social justice.

title: Project PEARLS
content: NGO dedicated to helping families in extreme poverty through food and education programs.
note: Focuses on vulnerable communities such as Tondo, Manila.

title: Philippine Red Cross
content: Provides health services, disaster relief, and humanitarian aid across the country.
note: National humanitarian organization with wide reach.

title: Save the Children Philippines
content: Works to improve children’s lives through education, nutrition, and protection.
note: Focused on ending child poverty and inequality.
